channel.title: Booting a UNIX OS
channel.description: Well, I got a Dell Dimension. With a harddrive with nothing on it. Well I plan on making this computer into a webserver, so I decided that a UNIX OS would be best. Well I put Ubuntu on it and I start it up and it says Boot Sector not found. How would I fix this (I'd rather not have ubuntu.)

item.title: Booting a UNIX OS
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote="(Anthony), post:6, topic:220946"][quote author=Mopman link=topic=290106.msg2340621#msg2340621 date=1216327322]

Well, I got a Dell Dimension. With a harddrive with nothing on it. Well I plan on making this computer into a webserver, so I decided that a UNIX OS would be best. Well I put Ubuntu on it and I start it up and it says Boot Sector not found. How would I fix this (I’d rather not have ubuntu.)

Are you running the server edition?

Why would that matter?
[/quote]
Mopman.
The server edition is all command-line based.
Unless accessing through webmin.[/quote]its cli after it has booted, which it hasnt…

Read full topic

item.title: Booting a UNIX OS

item.description:
@_bool wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:4, topic:220946”][quote author=(Anthony) link=topic=290106.msg2340609#msg2340609 date=1216326685]

Well, I got a Dell Dimension. With a harddrive with nothing on it. Well I plan on making this computer into a webserver, so I decided that a UNIX OS would be best. Well I put Ubuntu on it and I start it up and it says Boot Sector not found. How would I fix this (I’d rather not have ubuntu.)

Are you running the server edition?
[/quote]

Why would that matter?[/quote]
Mopman.
The server edition is all command-line based.
Unless accessing through webmin.
